Html:
Is there a way to show which files have changed in each build that fixes a specific bug? Maybe I just don't understand how to use the builds ... If that is the case, are there instructions?

However, it would be greatly helpful to know what files I have to add to my site to fix a bug (or even what code or if I have to regenerate the DB). Thanks!

That's really hard to tell. There can be more than 40 files that change at one time. The best way to do this is once the SvnBridge project is production-ready, I would hook it up to the ClubSK project and then you will be able to do an "Update To Revision". They you will be able to see a list of updated files.

If there are only a few files affected, would it be possible to note them? As a user/web master, the builds are not particularly helpful to me (it takes me 3 - 4 days to change everything to the MHRRC version of the site).
While I imagine some bugs may have far-reaching effects in many files, I would imagine that others are just a few lines of code or a few files.

I don't know about the SvnBridge project ... do you have an approximate time frame?

Maybe I am not understanding the purpose of the starter kit: 1) to be used as is with few modifications or 2) to highlight new technologies or 3) to be used the way I use it, as a starting place to build on. If it is (3), I need a reasonable way to fix bugs.

This in no way detracts from the work you are doing. I see version 3 as a great improvement over version 2 (even though I am not using the polling or the league tracking).
